Cairo international Airport terminal 2 building for  flights, even though it is newer building built in 2006, but it is really looks like 40 years building due to the following reasons : the design of the building inside did not utilize the space as much as possible and it has low ceiling profile that gives the building small looks. The bad maintenance management makes it very old as most of display screen ether not functioning properly or have a vague display. They used low quality equipment and machines which is not designed for airport operations. Although there are many security gates they have used only one gate where I entered the terminal number 2 building which caused long ques without control. The main street where the vehicle drop off the passenger is just two lanes that is not enough to accommodate the heavy traffic, I wish if they designed it with four lanes to reduce the bottle neck in the entrance.
The staff is very polite however they need more training that comply the airport industry regulations and standards. The bad design inside the terminal after the passport counter has very small and bad design and planning which will impact any future expansion of they decide to be an international hub in Africa and Middle East.
